properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The first heat event of the season is expected Thursday. A hot air mass is expected to pay a brief visit to the Thunder Bay area on Thursday, with afternoon temperatures near 30Â°C expected. Humidex values may reach the mid thirties. Cooler air from Lake Superior is expected to return by Thursday evening, with temperatures remaining somewhat lower Friday into the weekend. These conditions pose a health risk when you are not used to the heat. Everyone is at risk from heat, especially older adults; infants and young children; and people with chronic illnesses. You are advised to 1) drink plenty of cool liquids before feeling thirsty; and 2) keep cool by dressing for the weather and spending a few hours each day in a cool place. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-27T09:55:31-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-27T01:56:31-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0652002958.2019
Area: City of Thunder Bay, Cloud Bay - Dorion, Kakabeka Falls - Whitefish Lake - Arrow Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Thunderstorm activity over the BC Peace River region will continue into later this evening. There is a risk that some of these storms may produce nickel size hail and heavy downpours. ### Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-27T07:12:43-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-27T02:01:43-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2074203346.2019
Area: B.C. South Peace River, B.C. North Peace River
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. A developing low pressure system in southern Alberta will bring significant rainfall to parts of western Alberta beginning on Thursday. Rainfall with total amounts of 50 to 70 millimetres is expected by Saturday morning with locally higher amounts possible due to embedded thunderstorms. Scattered showers are expected through the day on Thursday before the heaviest rain begins in the evening. Heavy rain will continue through the day on Friday before gradually tapering off Friday overnight into Saturday morning. As the low pressure system continues to develop warnings may need to be expanded to include adjacent regions. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-27T20:21:31-00:00
